availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alladon C. Clark (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and teller)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and teller. Virginia native. Son of James J. Clark and Lucy A. Clark. Attended school in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Clerk for Quigley, Lyons, & Company in Louisville in 1861. Teller for Hunt, Morton, & Quigley in Louisville in 1865.
